content:
Hi, hijacking this topic to fuel a little bit the fire :-) What does T-doc mean?
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/labels/T-doc

"Relevant to the documentation team" is slightly ambiguous. My hunch is that it's not specifically T-rustdoc stuff, rather a generic label for all the teams to "remember to add documentation somewhere for this stuff"
I think it was the labels for the docs team which doesn't exist anymore

at a closer inspection I see that it is equally applied by rustbot (which would confirm your thinking), bu there are also exceptions
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/85716
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/84083
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/83999
... and so on ...

I think T-doc needs to be renamed to A-docs (or A-doc, but the plural version sounds better IMO). We shouldn't be assigning a label pointing to a team that no longer exists, but at the same time there needs to be a label for documentation issues.

inquisitivecrystal said:

I think T-doc needs to be renamed to A-docs (or A-doc, but the plural version sounds better IMO). We shouldn't be assigning a label pointing to a team that no longer exists, but at the same time there needs to be a label for documentation issues.

done
I've been meaning to do it but never got around to it
@Joshua Nelson thank you! This will make issues labeling a bit easier :-)
